interfaceFramework

Class Ghost

  • java.lang.Object
    • interfaceFramework.Ghost
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blinky

    public class Ghost
extends java.lang.Object
    The Ghost class deals with all the movements of the Ghost character

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ghost(int x, int y) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double distance(double tileX, double tileY, int x, int y)
      This is the method that calculates the distance between the Pac-Man and the Ghost
      int getX()
      getX return's Ghost's x coordinates at a specified time
      int getY()
      getY return's Ghost's y coordinates at a specified time
      void move(int[][] board, boolean[] ghostDirection)
      This is the method that controls the ghosts movement.
      boolean[] moveDown()
      This is the method that moves the ghost Down it sets the direction array index 3 (which corresponds to a down movement) to true
      boolean[] moveLeft()
      This is the method that moves the ghost Left it sets the direction array index 0 (which corresponds to a left movement) to true
      boolean[] moveRight()
      This is the method that moves the ghost Right it sets the direction array index 1 (which corresponds to a right movement) to true
      boolean[] moveUp()
      This is the method that moves the ghost Up it sets the direction array index 2 (which corresponds to a up movement) to true

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ghost

        public Ghost(int x,
     int y)

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(int[][] board,
        boolean[] ghostDirection)
        This is the method that controls the ghosts movement. It is set to random, however before a ghosts movements it checks if the upcoming coordinates are occupied with a wall.
        Parameters:
        ghost - Direction used to find a particular ghost's coordinates
        board - used to check upcoming coordinates for walls

      • getX

        public int getX()
        getX return's Ghost's x coordinates at a specified time

      • getY

        public int getY()
        getY return's Ghost's y coordinates at a specified time

      • moveLeft

        public boolean[] moveLeft()
        This is the method that moves the ghost Left it sets the direction array index 0 (which corresponds to a left movement) to true
        Returns:
        direction returns the boolean array specifying the direction

      • moveRight

        public boolean[] moveRight()
        This is the method that moves the ghost Right it sets the direction array index 1 (which corresponds to a right movement) to true
        Returns:
        direction returns the boolean array specifying the direction

      • moveUp

        public boolean[] moveUp()
        This is the method that moves the ghost Up it sets the direction array index 2 (which corresponds to a up movement) to true
        Returns:
        direction returns the boolean array specifying the direction

      • moveDown

        public boolean[] moveDown()
        This is the method that moves the ghost Down it sets the direction array index 3 (which corresponds to a down movement) to true
        Returns:
        direction returns the boolean array specifying the direction

      • distance

        public double distance(double tileX,
              double tileY,
              int x,
              int y)
        This is the method that calculates the distance between the Pac-Man and the Ghost
        Parameters:
        pacman - takes the pacman object as a parameter in order to get the pacman's coordinates
        x - x-coordinates of ghost
        y - y-coordinates of ghost
        Returns:
        distance returns the distance of Pac-Man from the ghost
